subject: Re: [junit] Re: About JunitReport
msgSnippet: Hi hitliubo , ... By capturing successful assertions do you mean things like: public void testMethod() { ... assertEquals(bar, objectUnderTest.foo()); ... }
messageBody:
Hi "hitliubo",

On 10/22/06, hitliubo <hitliubo@...> wrote:
> But in Junit, only failed assertions are recorded.
>
> I think Junitreport task can capture recorded assertions. However, I've
> no idea about how to make Junitreport to capture successful assertions'
> information which is i want to display.
>
> If you can give me an example about capture successful assertions and
> display at type column, that's very nice of you.

By "capturing successful assertions" do you mean things like:

public void testMethod() {
...
assertEquals(bar, objectUnderTest.foo());
...
}

If this is the case, then I'm afraid it's not possible without some
serious effort in instrumenting your compiled test classes. The first
problem to solve would be to define what is an "assertion"? Is it a
call to a method named "assert*"?

Personally, I think you should first look into making your test
methods more focused. If you're not sure from the JUnit test report
what is it your test methods are testing, they're either a) named
badly or b) testing too many things at once. By splitting your test
methods into small, focused tests (typically with just one assertion
per test) and naming them descriptively, you should be able to have
the information you're looking for in your reports.


Lasse
